sentences: Dr. Charlotte Friend, a medical microbiologist who made major contributions to the understanding of cancer during a career that spanned almost four decades, died Tuesday after a long illness.
Dr. Charlotte Friend, a medical microbiologist who made major contributions to the understanding of cancer during a career that spanned almost four decades, died Tuesday after a long illness.
Friend discovered a virus that causes leukemia in mice.
The virus, named the Friend virus, has been an important tool for study of the relationships between animal cancers and viruses for many years.
Friend was professor and director of the Center for Experimental Cell Biology at the Mount Sinai Medical Center.
Friend began studies of animal cancer viruses, most scientists considered it heretical to suggest that viruses might also be involved in human cancers.

The Friend virus has been so important in cancer research that it is the focus of an entire chapter in Oncogenic Viruses, a definitive text on cancer virus research by Dr. Ludwik Gross of the Veterans Administration Medical Center in the Bronx.
